data.name: BeltBurnishingUpLimit
data.value: Indicates the value of the upper quota required by the test. Set the value only if the field is editable.

data.name: BeltBurnishingDownLimit
data.value: Indicates the value of the lower quota required by the test. Set the value only if the field is editable.

data.name: BeltBurnishingRequiredCycles
data.value: Set the number of cycles required.

data.name: BeltBurnishingCompletedCycles
data.value: Displays the number of cycles currently completed.

data.name: BeltBurnishingActualPosition
data.value: Reports the current position of the axis.

data.name: BeltBurnishingStartCycle
data.value: Start the test. The test continues until the required number of cycles is reached or until the stop button is pressed.

data.name: BeltBurnishingStopCycle
data.value: Stop the test. The cycle stops at the end of the current movement. Pressing the cycle start button resumes test execution until completion.

data.name: BeltBurnishingFunctionDescription
data.value: The procedure allows to carry out a series of cycles of moving the vertical axis between two points indicated in the input data. The cycle, when started, continues either until the required cycles are reached or the end key is pressed.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationFunctionDescription
data.value: The vertical axis resolution calibration function allows you to calibrate the correct value by measuring in the field, then updating the default value proposed by the system. The procedure operates in successive steps until successful completion.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationInitialPositionHelp
data.value: If the field is editable, set the required initial quota.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationInitialStartHelp
data.value: Indicates the measured travel from the start to the end position.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationFinalPositionHelp
data.value: If the field is editable, set the final quota required.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationFinalPosizionStartHelp
data.value: The button starts moving the axis to the final position previously set.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationMeasuredeValueHelp
data.value: Indicates the measured travel from the start to the end position.

data.name: VerticalResolutionCalibrationStep1
data.value: Step 1: place axis at the initial position

data.name: VerticalResolutionCalibrationStep2
data.value: Step 2: place axis at the final dimension

data.name: VerticalResolutionCalibrationStep3
data.value: Step 3: Update the resolution to the new value

data.name: VerticalResolutionCalibrationStep4
data.value: Step 4: reposition axis and close the procedure

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationActualResolutionHelp
data.value: ResolutionCalibrationActualResolutionHelp

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationNewResolutionHelp
data.value: Displays the new resolution value calculated by the procedure.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationAcceptNewResolution
data.value: Replaces the previous resolution value with the new calculated value.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationGoToInitialPosizion
data.value: Return the axis to its initial position.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationCloseProcedure
data.value: Make the origin of the axis and close the procedure.

data.name: HelpInstallationStateDescription
data.value: Displays the current status of the installation. The parts already completed are highlighted in green while those to be completed or to be done are in gray. Some procedures are possible only after having correctly completed the preparatory ones.

data.name: HelpInstallationStateToDo
data.value: The gray indicator indicates a procedure still to be done

data.name: HelpInstallationStateDone
data.value: The green indicator indicates a successful procedure.

data.name: HelpSSTitle
data.value: Sensor status display

data.name: HelpSSDescription
data.value: The gray color indicates the inactive state of the sensor.

data.name: HelpSSStateOn
data.value: The green color indicates the active state of the sensor.

data.name: HelpSSStateOff
data.value: The gray color indicates the inactive state of the sensor.

data.name: HelpLSMTTitle
data.value: Low speed manual controls.

data.name: HelpLSMTDescription
data.value: It allows to carry out the movement of the various axes at low speed. A small movement space in both directions is set. The text of the buttons changes according to the required movement. Once the machine has been tested, it will be possible to control all the various axes at low speed without interlocks and for unlimited strokes.

data.name: HelpLSMTActualPosition
data.value: Indicates the current position or status for those parts that only have discrete positions.

data.name: HelpLSMTMoveUp
data.value: Button for forward movement, upward movement or opening according to the selected part

data.name: HelpLSMTMoveDown
data.value: Button for moving backward, downward or closed according to the selected part

data.name: HelpGCDescription
data.value: It allows to carry out a series of repetitive tests for the closing damper of the selected bay. It is possible to set a waiting time between two consecutive movements. The procedure ends when the set number of cycles is reached or at the exit.

data.name: HelpGCRequiredCycles
data.value: Set the number of cycles required.

data.name: HelpGCDelay
data.value: Set the delay time between two consecutive cycles.

data.name: HelpGCCompleted
data.value: Indicates the number of cycles currently completed.

data.name: HelpGCSensorA
data.value: Status of sensor A of the barrier.

data.name: HelpGCSensorB
data.value: Status of sensor B of the barrier.

data.name: HelpGCStartButton
data.value: Start the start of the required tests. The button is active if the number of required cycles is greater than zero.

data.name: HelpGCStopButton
data.value: Stops the loop when the current move is complete. The next press of the start button resumes the test from the cycle following the one stopped.

data.name: HelpVACDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to make the origin of the vertical axis at the end of which the current position indicated by the offset value is set. The procedure is preparatory for the realization of other functions that require the axis movement to height.

data.name: HelpVACDownLimit
data.value: Lower movement limit.

data.name: HelpVACUpLimit
data.value: Upper movement limit.

data.name: HelpVACOffset
data.value: Current offset value. At the end of the axis origin, the current quota is set to this value.

data.name: HelpVACResolution
data.value: Current resolution of the axis.

data.name: HelpVACFinalResult
data.value: Report the final outcome of the procedure.

data.name: HelpVacStart
data.value: Starts the vertical axis origin procedure.

data.name: HelpVACStop
data.value: Stops the vertical axis origin procedure.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationInitialReadValueHelp
data.value: Initial value of the current position read by the meter.

data.name: ResolutionCalibrationFinalReadValueHelp
data.value: Final value of the current position read by the meter.

data.name: HelpCCVDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to check and possibly correct the dimension of the selected cell. The correction is applied to the selected cell only.

data.name: HelpCCVSelectedCell
data.value: Set the cell whose dimension you want to check.

data.name: HelpCCVCellPosition
data.value: Indicates the dimension of the currently selected cell.

data.name: HelpCCVStepValue
data.value: Value of the change in height during the adjustment phase.

data.name: HelpCCVAttualPosition
data.value: Current value of the axis coordinate.

data.name: HelpCCVCorrectionValue
data.value: Total value of the correction to be applied.

data.name: HelpCCVSetPosition
data.value: Place the vertical axis at the selected cell.

data.name: HelpCCVStepPiu
data.value: Increases the current coordinate of the axis by the value indicated by the step.

data.name: HelpCCVStepMeno
data.value: Decreases the current coordinate of the axis by the value indicated by the step.

data.name: HelpCCVApplyCorrection
data.value: Step value applied to the current coordinate of the axis each time the movement buttons are pressed.

data.name: HelpVPPMDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to check the correct positioning of the various shelf door panels. Any correction is applied to all the cells belonging to the panel being tested.

data.name: HelpVPPMTotalPanels
data.value: Indicates the total number of panels on the side selected by the reference cell.

data.name: HelpVPPMActualPanel
data.value: Indicates the currently selected panel that is being checked.

data.name: HelpVPPMSelectedCell
data.value: Selected cell from which the panel to control is derived. Odd or even numbers select the front or back side.

data.name: HelpVPPMSelectedCellPosition
data.value: Dimension of the selected cell.

data.name: HelpVPPMActualPosition
data.value: Indicates the current position of the axis. It is changed by the action of the step buttons.

data.name: HelpVPPMStepValue
data.value: Step value to use when modifying the dimension.

data.name: HelpVPPMCorrectionValue
data.value: Total value of the correction that will be applied to the dimension of the selected cell.

data.name: HelpVPPMNextPanel
data.value: Allows you to go to the next panel to check.

data.name: HelpVPPMGoToCell
data.value: Place the axis at the selected cell.

data.name: HelpVPPMStepPiu
data.value: Increases the current coordinate of the axis by the value indicated by the step.

data.name: HelpVPPMStepMeno
data.value: Decreases the current coordinate of the axis by the value indicated by the step.

data.name: HelpVPPMApplyCorrection
data.value: Apply the correction to the group of cells in the currently selected panel.

data.name: HelpGHCDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to adjust the drawer height detection barrier. The height reached signal must also be used in the pre-positioning phase of the test template.

data.name: HelpGHCVelocity
data.value: Set the speed to be used during the calibration phase.

data.name: HelpGHCSystemError
data.value: Indicates the system error resulting from the set calibration speed and the system scan time. Reduce the speed to decrease the error.

data.name: HelpGHCTollerance
data.value: Sets the maximum tolerance allowed in the measurement. The test fails if the result exceeds the required value.

data.name: HelpGHCHeightReached
data.value: Indicates the activation of the beam used as a height verification element.

data.name: HelpGHCCurrentPosition
data.value: Returns the current position of the chain axis.

data.name: HelpGHCBarrierCorrection
data.value: Indicates the correction to be applied to the barrier. The plus sign requires to raise the barrier, the minus sign to lower it by the indicated value.

data.name: HelpGHCFinalResult
data.value: Report the final test result.

data.name: HelpGHCStart
data.value: The button starts the check procedure.

data.name: HelpGHCStop
data.value: The button stops the check procedure.

data.name: HelpWCDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to verify that the weight measurement falls within the expected tolerance. For the measurement, sample weights are used in the quantity indicated in the appropriate field.

data.name: HelpWCTestRun
data.value: Indicates the run performed at low speed during which the samples of the delivered current are carried out.

data.name: HelpWCWeightInserted
data.value: Indicates the sample weight entered for the test.

data.name: HelpWCWeightTollerance
data.value: Indicates the tolerance required by the measure.

data.name: HelpWCWeightMeasured
data.value: Indicates the weight measured by the system.

data.name: HelpWCFinalResult
data.value: Report the final outcome of the procedure. The result will be positive if the measured weight falls within the set tolerance.

data.name: HelpWCStart
data.value: Start the test procedure.

data.name: HelpWCStop
data.value: Stop the test procedure.

data.name: HelpVOCDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to correct the offset of the vertical axis in order to align the height of the various cells with the reference system of the vertical axis.

data.name: HelpVOCSelectedCell
data.value: Cell selected for checking.

data.name: HelpVOCCellPosition
data.value: Current elevation of the selected cell

data.name: HelpVOCStepValue
data.value: Value of the change in height to be applied each time the axis movement keys are pressed.

data.name: HelpVOCActualPosition
data.value: Current position of the vertical axis.

data.name: HelpVOCActualOffset
data.value: Current value of the vertical axis offset.

data.name: HelpVOCAdjustedOffset
data.value: New offset value.

data.name: HelpVOCGoToCell
data.value: Moves the vertical axis in to the dimension of the selected cell.

data.name: HelpVOCStepPiu
data.value: Increases the current height of the vertical axis by the set step value.

data.name: HelpVOCStepMeno
data.value: Decreases the current height of the vertical axis by the set step value.

data.name: HelpVOCApplyCorrection
data.value: Updates the vertical axis offset to the indicated value.

data.name: HelpCSCDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to modify a block of cells between the first and last selected. The selected side is automatically indicated based on the starting cell number depending on whether it is odd or even.

data.name: HelpCSCInitialCell
data.value: Set the starting cell number of the block.

data.name: HelpCSCFinalCell
data.value: Set the number of the final cell of the block.

data.name: HelpCSCCorrection
data.value: Set the desired value of the correction that will be applied to the selected cell group.

data.name: HelpCSCSelectedSide
data.value: Shows the side you are editing on. The side is automatically determined based on the selected starting cell number if even or odd.

data.name: HelpCSCApplyCorrection
data.value: Apply the correction to the selected cell group.

data.name: HelpLFDTotalCells
data.value: Indicates the total number of cells to be tested.

data.name: HelpLFDTestedCells
data.value: Indicates the number of cells currently tested.

data.name: HelpLFDCellInTest
data.value: Number of the cell currently being tested.

data.name: HelpLFDDrawerNumber
data.value: Number of the drawer being inserted.

data.name: HelpLFDMaxLoad
data.value: Maximum capacity of the drawer during loading.

data.name: HelpLFDInsertDrawer
data.value: Start the drawer insertion procedure. The procedure ends when the planned cycles are completed.

data.name: HelpLFDRecallDrawer
data.value: Recall the drawer used for the test in the bay.

data.name: HelpLFDDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to use the drawer selected in the appropriate input field to test the lower and upper cells of the machine as well as the cells below and above the cell blocks indicated as disabled. The purpose of the procedure is to verify that there is no mechanical interference in these areas.

data.name: HelpLDRDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to insert the empty drawers inside the machine at the end of the commissioning procedure. The drawers are inserted inside the free blocks choosing them according to the lowest priority.

data.name: HelpLDRTotalDrawers
data.value: Total number of drawers to be inserted.

data.name: HelpLDRInsertedDrawers
data.value: Drawers already inserted in the car.

data.name: HelpLDRDrawerToInsert
data.value: Number of the drawer being inserted. It can be generated by the appropriate button or inserted in the appropriate field.

data.name: HelpLDRMaxLoad
data.value: Indicates the maximum capacity allowed for the drawer currently being inserted.

data.name: HelpLDRNextDrawer
data.value: The button sets the next drawer to be inserted. the number is the one following the last one entered.

data.name: HelpLDRStart
data.value: Starts the procedure for inserting the selected drawer.

data.name: HelpBCTRDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to check and possibly correct the height of the various possible positions on the various bays. The procedure is suitable for the type of bay indicated in the document that describes the machine configuration. In the case of several positions on the same bay, the procedure allows multiple checks.

data.name: HelpBCTRSelectedBay
data.value: Select the bay whose odds you want to check.

data.name: HelpBCTRSelectedPosition
data.value: Indicates the position inside the selected bay whose heights you want to check. It is set automatically.

data.name: HelpBCTRPositionHeight
data.value: Displays the elevation of the selected position within the bay under control.

data.name: HelpBCTRStepValue
data.value: Step value applied to the current coordinate of the axis each time the movement buttons are pressed.

data.name: HelpBCTRCorrectionValue
data.value: Cumulative value of the correction that will be applied to the height of the selected bay-position.

data.name: HelpBCTRMoveToPosition
data.value: Place the vertical axis at the selected bay-location.

data.name: HelpBCTRStepPiu
data.value: Increases the current coordinate of the axis by the value indicated by the step.

data.name: HelpBCTRStepMeno
data.value: Decreases the current coordinate of the axis by the value indicated by the step.

data.name: HelpBCTRAdjust
data.value: Corrects the current height of the bay-current position by the value indicated in the appropriate field.

data.name: HelpBCTRNextPosition
data.value: If enabled, the button allows you to choose the next position in the currently selected bay. The procedure must be repeated for the new position.

data.name: HelpIPGDescription
data.value: The main menu allows access to all the functions foreseen for the machine commissioning phase.

data.name: HelpIPGHeder
data.value: Main menu.

data.name: HelpIPGError
data.value: Indicates, when visible, the presence of an error. Pressing the button opens the window dedicated to restoring the situation.

data.name: HelpIPGOff
data.value: The Off status of this button indicates the disabling of the machine movements.

data.name: HelpIPGOn
data.value: The On state of this button indicates that the machine is enabled to move.

data.name: HelpIPGInstaller
data.value: Indicates the name of the user currently logged in. If pressed, it allows you to log out of the system.

data.name: HelpIPGHelp
data.value: If pressed, opens the contextual menu for the currently selected function.

data.name: HelpIPGUp
data.value: Allows you to scroll up the list of buttons for accessing the various functions.

data.name: HelpIPGButton
data.value: List of buttons to access the installation functions.

data.name: HelpIPGDown
data.value: Allows you to scroll down the list of buttons for accessing the various functions.

data.name: HelpDLUTDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to carry out a series of boarding and disembarking tests of a drawer using the bay selected in the appropriate input fields. For the test it is possible to vary the acceleration, deceleration and speed feed rate according to what is indicated in the appropriate field. The test continues until the required number of cycles is reached or until the stop button is pressed.

data.name: HelpDLUTBay
data.value: Enter the number of the bay on which you want to perform the test.

data.name: HelpDLUTPosition
data.value: Enter the position inside the bay on which you want to perform the test.

data.name: HelpDLUTFeedRate
data.value: Enter the feed rate required for the test. The reduction also affects the acceleration and deceleration values.

data.name: HelpDLUTChain
data.value: It reports the current position of the chain axis as a value relative to the starting height.

data.name: HelpDLUTCyclesRequired
data.value: Enter the number of test cycles required.

data.name: HelpDLUTCycleCompleted
data.value: Reports the number of complete cycles currently performed.

data.name: HelpDLUTGotoPosition
data.value: Moves the vertical axis to the position inside the selected bay. The fee takes into account the boarding offset.

data.name: HelpDLUTStart
data.value: Start the test procedure. The button is active only after the vertical axis is at the required position in the bay.

data.name: HelpDLUTStop
data.value: Stop the test cycle.

data.name: HelpLSMTComandMode
data.value: It reports the mode currently enabled for manual commands. Extended stroke mode is automatically set after commissioning is complete.

data.name: HelpSRCPageHeader
data.value: Cancel the file saving procedure.

data.name: HelpSRCDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to save or recover configuration files on the external device.

data.name: HelpSRCSaveSide
data.value: Configuration saving procedure.

data.name: HelpSRCSaveFolder
data.value: Indicates the automatically created folder where the configuration files will be saved.

data.name: HelpSRCSaveButton
data.value: Start the procedure for saving the configuration files. Any files already present will be overwritten.

data.name: HelpSRCSaveConfirmButton
data.value: Confirm the file saving procedure.

data.name: HelpSRCSaveAbortButton
data.value: Cancel the file saving procedure.

data.name: HelpSRCLoadSide
data.value: Configuration restore procedure.

data.name: HelpSRCLoadButton
data.value: Start the configuration files upload procedure. Any files already present will be overwritten.

data.name: HelpSRCLoadConfirmButton
data.value: Confirm the file upload procedure.

data.name: HelpSRCLoadAbortButton
data.value: Cancel the file upload procedure.

data.name: HelpOpMainPageHeadr
data.value: First page.

data.name: HelpOpMainPageDescription
data.value: The main menu allows you to check the machine status using the appropriate buttons at the top of the screen. On the left side, using the navigation buttons, it is possible to access the various functions.

data.name: HelpOpMainManu
data.value: Indicates the manual condition. The automatic cycle is suspended.

data.name: HelpOpMainAuto
data.value: Indicates the automatic condition. The machine manages the commands coming from the control system.

data.name: HelpOpMainOff
data.value: The power to the motors is disabled. Movements are not possible in any mode.

data.name: HelpOpMainOn
data.value: The power to the motors is enabled. The machine is able to make movements.

data.name: HelpOpMainServiceAdvice
data.value: The system signals that some parts of the machine are approaching the time for scheduled maintenance.

data.name: HelpOpMainServiceAllert
data.value: The system signals that some parts of the machine have reached the end of the scheduled period between two maintenance operations. Maintenance required!

data.name: HelpOpMainError
data.value: An error occurred while the machine was running. Pressing this button opens the page for managing the recovery procedures.

data.name: HelpOpMainUser
data.value: Reports the name of the currently logged in operator. Pressing the button allows you to log off.

data.name: HelpOpMainHelp
data.value: The button opens the help page contextual to the procedure you are using.

data.name: HelpOpMainDrawerOp
data.value: The button opens the page for managing the operations scheduled on the drawer in the bay.

data.name: HelpOpMainItem
data.value: The button opens the page that allows you to search for an article code.

data.name: HelpOpMainLists
data.value: The button opens the display page of the lists pending execution scheduled by the WMS.

data.name: HelpOpMainOther
data.value: Allows access to additional functions.

data.name: HelpDrawerWaitDescription
data.value: The page indicates that the system has completed the operations planned on the last drawer arrived in the bay. It is awaiting the arrival of the next drawer which will cause the opening of the page dedicated to the planned operations.

data.name: HelpDrawerWaitNote
data.value: The note reports the current situation of the system.

data.name: HelpDrawerWaitScheduledOperations
data.value: The field reports the number of operations currently scheduled towards the bay on which the operator works.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDescription
data.value: The procedure provides all the detailed information relating to the withdrawal operation scheduled on the drawer present in the bay where the user operates. The drawing, if present, shows the division of the drawer and the highlighted area indicates the compartment on which to operate. If present, the image of the item being handled is also shown.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingQtyRequest
data.value: The quantity of the item to be removed from the highlighted compartment is displayed.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingQtyPicked
data.value: The user can change the quantity actually withdrawn in the event that the stock is not sufficient. Under normal conditions the field is already filled with the required quantity.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDetailDescription
data.value: The window shows a series of additional information to those present in the picking window. Detailed information is displayed both for the item being picked and for any associated packing list. If present, the article image is also displayed.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDetailListRow
data.value: Shows the row of the list to which the withdrawal operation in progress refers.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDetailProductionDate
data.value: The production date of the item being picked is indicated.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDetailLotto
data.value: If present, the production lot of the item being picked is indicated.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDetailMaterialStatus
data.value: If required, the state of the material subject to withdrawal is indicated.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDetailPackListCode
data.value: If applicable, it indicates the packing list where information relating to the various items being picked is collected.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDetailPackListDescription
data.value: If present, it indicates the description of the packing list that unites the materials being picked.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDetailBoxType
data.value: Provides indication of the type of packaging of the item being picked.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityPickingDetailQtyRequest
data.value: The quantity of the item to be removed from the highlighted compartment is displayed.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingDetailDescription
data.value: The page shows the details of the deposit operation currently in progress. More details about the operations to be performed are provided on the basic page.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingDetailListRow
data.value: Indicates the row of the list involved in the operation in progress.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingDetailProductionDate
data.value: Reports from the item's production date.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingDetailMaterialStatus
data.value: Shows the material status of the item being paid.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingDetailLotto
data.value: Indicates the row of the list involved in the operation in progress.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingDetailPackaging
data.value: Indicates the type of packaging of the item being paid.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingDetailQtyToRefill
data.value: Amount to be poured into the indicated compartment.

data.name: HelpCommonList
data.value: The code of the list associated with the procedure in progress is indicated.

data.name: HelpCommonListDescription
data.value: Shows the description of the list associated with the operation in progress.

data.name: HelpCommonItem
data.value: Indicates the code of the item involved in the operation in progress.

data.name: HelpCommonItemDescription
data.value: The description of the item that is the subject of the current operation is displayed.

data.name: HelpCommonPosition
data.value: The field indicates the position in which the compartment object of the operation in progress is located, mapped according to the coding adopted.

data.name: HelpCommonNote
data.value: Any notes associated with the operation to be performed are shown to the operator.

data.name: HelpCommonDetail
data.value: The button allows you to enter the page that shows further details relating to the operation in progress.

data.name: HelpCommonConfirm
data.value: Confirm that the current operation has been completed.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingDescription
data.value: The procedure makes it possible to refill the compartment that contains the item with the same characteristics as the one in payment. The procedure allows to update the maximum capacity of the compartment if the recorded value is wrong.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingQtyToRefill
data.value: Amount to pour into the selected compartment.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingUpdateMaxQty
data.value: Opens the page for managing the update of the maximum capacity of the compartment.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityRefillingQtyRefilled
data.value: Allows you to set the amount actually poured into the selected compartment.

data.name: HelpCommonGridColumnHeader
data.value: Column description of the table.

data.name: HelpCommonUp
data.value: Move the pointer to the previous item. Double pressing moves to the beginning of the list.

data.name: HelpCommonDown
data.value: Move the pointer to the next item. Double-pressing moves to the end of the list.

data.name: HelpListsInWaitDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to view all the lists pending execution by the WMS system. The machines involved are indicated for each list. It is possible to execute only the portion of lists that have some article to be taken present in the machine from which the procedure is being used.

data.name: HelpListsInWaitGridList
data.value: The grid column presents the codes of the lists awaiting execution.

data.name: HelpListsInWaitGridDescription
data.value: The column of the grid presents the description of the lists awaiting execution.

data.name: HelpListsInWaitGridMachine
data.value: The column shows, for each list, the list of machines involved for its execution.

data.name: HelpListsInWaitListsDetail
data.value: The button allows you to access the detail page of the list where you can see the list of articles present.

data.name: HelpListsInWaitListsExecute
data.value: The button, if active, allows you to execute the list currently selected for the portion present in the machine you are working on.

data.name: HelpDetailListsInWaitGridRow
data.value: Shows the row number of the displayed list.

data.name: HelpDetailListsInWaitGridItem
data.value: Indicate the article code.

data.name: HelpDetailListsInWaitGridItemDescription
data.value: Report the description of the item.

data.name: HelpDetailListsInWaitGridQuantity
data.value: Indicates the required quantity of that item.

data.name: HelpDetailListsInWaitDescription
data.value: The page shows the detail of the selected list. Within all the displayed lines it is possible to execute only those which are highlighted because the article is contained in the machine on which you are working. The "Run list" button is active only if there is at least one executable line in the machine you are working on.

data.name: HelpItemSearchDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to search for an article using both the code and description columns. The text entered in the search field is automatically used to find what is required using the contents of the two columns. The result is displayed in the grid.

data.name: HelpItemSearchGridItem
data.value: It shows the list of article codes that match the search criteria.

data.name: HelpItemSearchGridItemDescription
data.value: It shows the description of the article codes that match the search criteria.

data.name: HelpItemSearchGridMachine
data.value: Indicates the list of machines that contain the item indicated in the row. An article can be present in one or more machines.

data.name: HelpItemSearchTextToFind
data.value: Enter the sequence of characters to search for in the code and item description fields in the field.

data.name: HelpItemSearchQtyAvailable
data.value: Indicates the available quantity of the selected item inside the machine you are working on.

data.name: HelpItemSearchQtyRequired
data.value: The field is enabled only if the quantity available for the selected item is greater than zero. It is possible to insert a value not exceeding the available quantity.

data.name: HelpItemSearchItemCall
data.value: Allows you to request the selected item in the required quantity. The button is enabled only if the item is available on the machine where you are working.

data.name: HelpItemSearchDetailDescription
data.value: The page displays the main data of the selected article. More detailed information can be viewed at the management WMS level.

data.name: HelpItemSearchDetailMangementType
data.value: Indicates how to manage the article.

data.name: HelpItemSearchDetailFifoPeriod
data.value: Indicates the Fifo period of the article, expressed in the unit of measurement indicated.

data.name: HelpItemSearchDetailCategory
data.value: Categoria di appartenenza dell'articolo.

data.name: HelpItemSearchDetailClasse
data.value: Handling class of the selected item.

data.name: HelpItemSearchDetailMeasurementUnit
data.value: Unit of measure selected for the item.

data.name: HelpItemSearchDetailAverageWeight
data.value: Average unit weight expressed in the unit of measurement indicated.

data.name: HelpDetailListsInWaitListExecute
data.value: Allows the execution of the highlighted list lines. The button is enabled only if at least one row of the selected list can be executed on the machine you are working on.

data.name: HelpDetailListsInWaitMachine
data.value: The column shows the machine or machines on which the article is currently present.

data.name: HelpImmediateDrawerCallDescription
data.value: The procedure allows to call the selected drawer in the bay on which the operator is working. The drawers with the red status are not accessible to the user who is working as they are blocked by the WMS or associated with a particular user.

data.name: HelpImmediateDrawerCallGridDrawer
data.value: Indicates the number of the drawer to which the grid data refers.

data.name: HelpImmediateDrawerCallGridHeight
data.value: Current height of the selected drawer.

data.name: HelpImmediateDrawerCallGridWeight
data.value: Indicates the current weight of the selected drawer.

data.name: HelpImmediateDrawerCallGridCell
data.value: Indicates the cell in which it is stored in the drawer.

data.name: HelpImmediateDrawerCallGridSide
data.value: Indicates the side of the machine where the drawer is stored.

data.name: HelpImmediateDrawerCallGridStatus
data.value: Reports the current status of the drawer. The red color indicates that the drawer cannot be recalled by the currently connected user.

data.name: HelpImmediateDrawerCallRequestedDrawer
data.value: Shows the number of the drawer to be recalled.

data.name: HelpImmediateDrawerCallDrawerCall
data.value: The button allows you to recall the drawer currently selected in the grid. The button is active if the drawer can be called up by the current user.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDescription
data.value: Activates the compaction procedure for the rear side of the machine. The button is active if it is possible to recover the required space.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingSide
data.value: Indicates the side of the machine to which the data provided refers.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingFragment
data.value: Indicates the number of lost fragments present on the current side.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingSpaceRecoverable
data.value: Report the maximum space that can be recovered on the current side.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingSpaceToRecover
data.value: Space to recover. By default it is set to the maximum value of recoverable space.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingCompactFront
data.value: Activates the compaction procedure for the front side of the machine. The button is active if it is possible to recover the required space.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingCompactRear
data.value: Activates the compaction procedure for the rear side of the machine. The button is active if it is possible to recover the required space.

data.name: HelpDrawerSpaceSaturationDescription
data.value: Space to recover. By default it is set to the maximum value of recoverable space.

data.name: HelpDrawerSpaceSaturationGridDrawer
data.value: Indicates the drawer number.

data.name: HelpDrawerSpaceSaturationGridMissions
data.value: Indicates the number of missions the drawer has been subject to.

data.name: HelpDrawerSpaceSaturationGridCompartments
data.value: Indicates the number of mapped compartments, present inside the drawer regardless of their status.

data.name: HelpDrawerSpaceSaturationTotalDrawer
data.value: Reports the total number of drawers allocated in the machine.

data.name: HelpDrawerSpaceSaturationDimension
data.value: Shows the size of the drawers stored inside the machine.

data.name: HelpDrawerSpaceSaturationMachineFilling
data.value: Indicates, in both graphic and numerical form, the total filling degree of the machine.

data.name: HelpDrawerSpaceSaturationWeightAnalisys
data.value: Allows access to the statistical analysis procedure relating to the weight allocated in the various drawers.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationDescription
data.value: The procedure provides data on the weight allocated in the various drawers and, globally, inside the machine. For each drawer, further information is provided, including the current height, the maximum weight that can be loaded for each drawer, the tare, the current total weight, as well as the percentage of the current weight compared to the maximum provided both in graphical and numerical form. A global indication valid for the whole machine is also provided.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationGridDrawer
data.value: Indicates the drawer number.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationGridHeight
data.value: Current drawer height.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationGridMaxWeight
data.value: Indicates the maximum weight allowed for the drawer.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationGridGross
data.value: Indicates the weight of the empty drawer.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationGridActualWeight
data.value: Reports the current weight of the drawer.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationGridWeightPercent
data.value: Indicates the percentage of weight used referred to the maximum possible.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationTotalDrawers
data.value: Indicates the maximum number of drawers allocated in the machine.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationGrossCapacityMax
data.value: Shows the maximum gross capacity of the machine.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationGrossLoaded
data.value: Indicates the gross weight loaded.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationNetCapacity
data.value: Maximum net flow allowed by the machine.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationNetLoaded
data.value: Indicates the net weight currently loaded.

data.name: HelpDrawerWeightSaturationWeightPercent
data.value: Shows the current percentage of loaded weight referred to the maximum allowed weight.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsDescription
data.value: The procedure provides statistical data of the main parts of the machine. The data provided refer to what the machine has done during its life cycle from the moment of installation.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsVerticalCycles
data.value: Indicates the total number of cycles performed by the vertical axis. A cycle is equivalent to a shift between two points.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsVerticalKm
data.value: It reports the totalisation of the Km. Traveled by the vertical axis from the moment of installation.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsShutter1
data.value: It reports the total number of cycles performed by the shutter that equips bay n. 1. A cycle is a total or intermediate opening or closing operation.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsShutter2
data.value: It reports the total number of cycles performed by the shutter that equips bay n. 2. A cycle is a total or intermediate opening or closing operation.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsShutter3
data.value: It reports the total number of cycles performed by the shutter that equips bay n. 3. A cycle is a total or intermediate opening or closing operation.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsHorizontalCycles
data.value: The field shows the total number of cycles carried out by the chain on the machine lift since installation. A cycle is an embarkation or disembarkation operation.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsBay1
data.value: The field shows the total number of drawers that have affected bay n. 2. The count increases when a drawer is brought into the bay and then returned to the warehouse.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsBay2
data.value: The field shows the total number of drawers that have affected bay n. 2. The count increases when a drawer is brought into the bay and then returned to the warehouse.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsBay3
data.value: The field shows the total number of drawers that have affected bay n. 3. The count increases when a drawer is brought into the bay and then returned to the warehouse.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageGridKit
data.value: The column shows the kit code for the selected component.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageGridDescription
data.value: The column shows the description of the various kits.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageGridState
data.value: Indicates the current status of the kit. the orange color indicates the approach of maintenance, the red period expired and therefore maintenance required.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageGridRequest
data.value: The column indicates that a request for intervention has already been made to the maintenance staff for a specific kit.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageModel
data.value: Show the machine model.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageSerial
data.value: Report the serial number of the machine.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageInstallation
data.value: Reports the machine installation date.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageLastMaintenance
data.value: Indicates the date on which the last maintenance was performed.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageNextMaintenance
data.value: Indicates the estimated date for the next maintenance.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceMainPageMachineStatus
data.value: Indicates the current status of the kit. the orange color indicates the approach of maintenance, the red period expired and therefore maintenance required.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailDescription
data.value: The page allows you to view the data on which the maintenance of the selected kit is based. All the information used by the system to determine scheduled maintenance operations is displayed.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailGridElement
data.value: Shows the part number used by the selected maintenance kit.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailGridDescription
data.value: Reports the description of the component used in the selected kit.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailGridQuantity
data.value: Indicates the number of pieces of the element required in the selected kit.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailCyclesTotal
data.value: Total number of cycles completed since the machine was installed.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailCyclesFromLastMaint
data.value: Reports the number of cycles performed since the last maintenance.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailCyclesBetweenTwoMaint
data.value: Indicates the number of cycles that can be carried out between two maintenance operations.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailElementStatus
data.value: It reports the status of the kit with the convention that the orange color indicates the approach of maintenance and the red that the maintenance is expired.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailHoursRequired
data.value: Indicates the number of hours required to carry out the required maintenance operation.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailPlatformRequired
data.value: Indicates whether the use of a platform for work at height is necessary for the maintenance operation to be carried out.

data.name: HelpMaintenanceDetailSendRequestContact
data.value: It allows you to send an email to the assistance office asking to be contacted to arrange a maintenance intervention.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoDescription
data.value: The page presents a series of general information relating to the machine on which you are working. Among other information, the date of the next maintenance is also displayed. In case there are more maintenances due, the most recent date is displayed.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoModel
data.value: Shows the model of the machine you are working on.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoSerial
data.value: Indicates the serial number of the machine you are working on.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoSwRelease
data.value: Shows the release of the SW currently installed on the machine.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoTotalDrawers
data.value: Total number of drawers inserted in the machine.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoInstallationDate
data.value: Reports the machine installation date.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoLastMaintenanceDate
data.value: Indicates the date of the last maintenance.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoNextMaintenanceDate
data.value: Indicates the estimated date of the next maintenance.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoMachineStatus
data.value: Reports the current maintenance status of the machine.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataDescription
data.value: The page displays some statistical information relating to the use of the drawer area and the total weight loaded in relation to the characteristics of the machine. Information on the use of the machine is also displayed.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataMovedDrawers
data.value: Total number of drawers moved since the start of installation.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataOccupiedArea
data.value: Indicates the percentage of area occupied inside the machine referred to the total space available.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataLoadedWeight
data.value: Total number of drawers moved since the start of installation.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataPowerOnTotalTime
data.value: Reports the total power on time since the machine was installed.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataAutomaticTotalTime
data.value: Indicates the ratio between the total time elapsed in automatic mode and the switch-on time from the moment of installation.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataUseRatio
data.value: The utilization coefficient indicates the ratio between the time spent in automatic moving drawers and that of ignition.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsDescription
data.value: The procedure shows the statistical data relating to the cells present inside the machine. In addition to the global data relating to the front and rear side, the data relating to the number of cells in the various states provided for both the front and rear sides are displayed.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsGridStatus
data.value: Reports the status of the cell to which the row data refers.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsGridTotAnt
data.value: Shows the total of the cells that have the status indicated in the first column of the grid referring to the front side.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsGridPercTotAnt
data.value: Indicates the percentage of cells that have the status indicated in the first column of the grid referring to the front side.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsGridTotPost
data.value: Shows the total of the cells that have the status indicated in the first column of the grid referring to the front side.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsGridPercTotPost
data.value: Indicates the percentage of cells that have the status indicated in the first column of the grid referring to the back side.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsCellsTot
data.value: Total number of cells present in the machine.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsCellsAnt
data.value: Total number of cells present on the front of the machine.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsCellsPost
data.value: Total number of cells present on the rear side of the machine.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsTotalOccupiedCells
data.value: Shows the percentage of occupied cells referred to the total of cells present.

data.name: HelpCellsStatisticsButtonOther
data.value: The button allows access to the storage space compaction procedure.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataButtonCellsStatistics
data.value: Activate the cell statistics display page.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataButtonDrawersStatistics
data.value: Displays the statistical data page of the various drawers present in the machine.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataButtonMachineStatistics
data.value: Allows access to the display page of the statistical data of the machine.

data.name: HelpStatisticsGeneralDataButtonErrorsStatistics
data.value: Activates the page for displaying the statistical data relating to errors generated by the machine since installation.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoButtonDrawerCall
data.value: View the page dedicated to immediate call by drawer.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoButtonCompacting
data.value: Allows access to the management page of the storage space compaction procedures.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoButtonStastistics
data.value: Allows you to access the section dedicated to the statistical information relating to the machine you are working on.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoButtonMaintenance
data.value: Opens the page dedicated to the maintenance operations foreseen for the machine on which you are working.

data.name: HelpErrorsStatisticsDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to access the error statistics display page relating to the machine you are working on. The statistics covers the entire period from the moment of installation to the moment of consultation.

data.name: HelpErrorsStatisticsGridError
data.value: The column of the table shows the list of error codes generated by the machine on which you are working.

data.name: HelpErrorsStatisticsGridTotal
data.value: The percentage incidence of each individual error is indicated in relation to the total errors counted.

data.name: HelpErrorsStatisticsGridPercTotal
data.value: HelpErrorsStatisticsGridPercTotal

data.name: HelpErrorsStatisticsTotalDrawersMoved
data.value: The field shows the total number of drawers handled since the beginning of the installation. A drawer is considered to be moved when moved from a source to a destination.

data.name: HelpErrorsStatisticsErrorDescription
data.value: The complete description of the error selected in the table is displayed.

data.name: HelpErrorsStatisticsTotaleErrors
data.value: The total number of errors that the machine has counted since installation is displayed.

data.name: HelpErrorsStatisticsTotalDrawersNoError
data.value: The field shows a statistical data calculated by the system that refers to the average of the drawers moved without errors.

data.name: HelpErrorsStatisticsReliability
data.value: The system calculates the reliability coefficient of the machine as the ratio between the number of errors counted and the total of the moved drawers.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityInventoryDescription
data.value: The page presents the main data relating to the inventory operation to be carried out on the various items allocated in the drawer in the bay. The procedure, once the compartment containing the requested item has been indicated, waits for the operator to insert the quantity of pieces currently in stock.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityInventoryQtyStored
data.value: The field shows the quantity of pieces currently in stock counted by the operator.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityInventoryDetailDescription
data.value: The page provides the operator with further details on the inventory operation currently in progress.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityInventoryDetailProductionDate
data.value: Reports the production date of the item currently in inventory.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityInventoryDetailMaterialStatus
data.value: Indicates the material status of the item being inventory.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityInventoryDetailLotto
data.value: Reports the production batch of the item in the inventory phase.

data.name: HelpDrawerActivityInventoryDetailPackaging
data.value: Report the type of packaging used for the item being inventory.

data.name: HelpListsInWaitGridType
data.value: It indicates the type of list according to the following code: P: pick V: put I: Inventory

data.name: HelpCommonListType
data.value: Indicates the type of list selected according to the following code: P: Pick V: put I: Inventory.

data.name: HelpGeneralInfoWmsStatus
data.value: The field reports the current status of the WMS, if present, which controls the machine you are working on.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailDescription
data.value: The page shows the progress of the compaction procedure. The drawer being moved and from which cell it is withdrawn and to which cell it is destined is indicated. The progress of the procedure is also shown with an indication of the fragments and the space to be recovered in addition to the space already recovered.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailDrawer
data.value: Indicates the code of the drawer currently being moved.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailSourceCell
data.value: Indicates the source cell where the drawer being handled was stored.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailDestinationCell
data.value: Indicates the cell number where the drawer will be moved during handling.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailCurrentStep
data.value: It reports the current phase of the handling cycle of the various drawers.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailVerticalPosition
data.value: Shows the current position of the vertical axis.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailOrizzontalPosition
data.value: Indicates the current position of the horizontal axis.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailFragmentRemaining
data.value: Indicates the number of fragments still to be packed.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailRecoveredSpace
data.value: Indicates the total space currently reclaimed.

data.name: HelpDrawerCompactingDetailSpaceToRecover
data.value: Reports the space required to be recovered after which the procedure ends.

data.name: HelpMachineStatisticsShutter
data.value: It reports the total number of cycles performed by the shutter that equips bay n. 1. A cycle is a total or intermediate opening or closing operation.

data.name: CarouselCalibrationFunctionDescription
data.value: The carousel calibration function allows you to calibrate the correct value by performing a series of consecutive automatic movements, then updating the default value proposed by the system. The procedure works in successive steps until correct completion.

data.name: ExternalBayCalibrationFunctionDescription
data.value: The external bay calibration function allows you to calibrate the correct value by performing a series of consecutive automatic movements, then updating the default value proposed by the system. The procedure works in successive steps until correct completion.

data.name: BayOperationsDescription
data.value: The procedure allows you to view the type of operations possible on the current bay

data.name: BayOperationsDescriptionWarning
data.value: ATTENTION: If a type of operation is disabled, the lists sent by the WMS will be rejected
